Thirupathi and Thirumala

Thirupathi, also known as Tirupati, is a popular pilgrimage destination located in the state of Andhra Pradesh, India. It is renowned for its ancient and sacred temples, especially the Sri Venkateswara Temple situated on the Tirumala hills, also known as Thirumala.

Sri Venkateswara Temple

The main attraction of Thirupathi is the Sri Venkateswara Temple, dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. It is one of the most visited and richest temples in the world. The temple's stunning architecture, intricate carvings, and spiritual significance make it a must-visit for devotees and tourists alike.

Scenic Beauty

Thirumala is situated amidst the scenic beauty of the Eastern Ghats, providing breathtaking views of the surrounding hills and lush greenery. The serene and tranquil environment adds to the spiritual experience of the visitors.

Tirumala Ghat Roads

The journey to the top of the Tirumala hills is an experience in itself. The ghat roads leading to the temple are well-known for their hairpin bends, offering panoramic views of the valleys and forests below. The drive through these roads is both thrilling and picturesque.
